name: Trescao (jumper)
description: This pattern is available for free as a thank you for your support !
languages: ...and 6 other languages show hide other languages
full_text: This pattern is available for free as a thank you for your support! Get 10% off your next Along with Anna pattern purchase when you subscribe to our newsletter! This free newsletter is the best way to receive our introductory discount codes for new pattern releases. We are also sharing event announcements, inspiration tips, and many more! Join us and explore your creativity with Along with Anna! This pattern is available as a free download to thank you for your loyalty to Along avec Anna! Get 10% off your next Along with Anna pattern purchase by subscribing to our newsletter! This free newsletter is the best way to receive our launch discount codes for new pattern releases. We also share event announcements, inspirations and more! Join us and explore your creativity with Along with Anna! Trescao is a crop raglan sleeve jumper, whose back is slightly longer than the front. It is thought to be worn on dresses, skirts or high-waisted trousers. The garter stitch gives it a feminine look. Its simple but elegant, very easy to wear and it will become a staple in your wardrobe. Very accessible to beginners. Can be knitted either with a single DK yarn, or with a fingering and a mohair to make it more cozy for the winter. The construction is top-down. SIZES: Finished bust measurements 80, 85, 90 (95, 100, 105, 110, 115) 120, 125, 130, 135, 140 145, 150, 155, 160, 165 cm RECOMMENDED EASE: between 3 and 10 cm of positive ease GAUGE: 21 m x 31 r = 10 cm in stockinette stitch in the round in 4mm/US 6 needles (or another size to get the gauge) YARN 1 strand of Double Merino (DK) only - about 600, 670, 715 (760, 805, 850, 905, 960) 1005, 1070, 1130, 1180, 1240 1295, 1360, 1410, 1465, 1515 meters So 6, 7, 7(7, 8, 8, 9, 9) 10, 10, 11, 11, 12 12, 13, 13, 14, 14 balls of Double Merino - Along with Anna OR 2 strands of Merino + Silk-Mohair: about the same amount of each yarn for a mix fingering and mohair so 3, 4, 4 (4, 4, 5, 5, 5) 5, 6, 6, 6,7 7, 7, 8, 8, 8 balls of Merino - Along avec Anna and 3, 4, 4(4, 4, 5, 5, 5) 5, 6, 6, 6, 7 7, 7, 8, 8, 8 balls of Silk Mohair - Along avec Anna Sample versions: Along Avec Anna Merino Fingering + Silk Mohair, colorway Emerald / Tourmaline, in size 90cm with 10cm positive ease. NEEDLES: Recommended needles (or another size to get the gauge): 4mm/US 6 for body and sleeves 3.75mm/US 5 for garter stitch NOTIONS: 3 stitch markers, scrap yarn, tapestry needle Trescao is a fairly short raglan sleeve sweater (crop), whose back is slightly longer than the front. It is designed to be worn over dresses, or high-waisted skirts and pants. The garter stitch finishes give it a feminine side. Its simple but elegant cut makes it very easy to wear and it will become a good basic in your wardrobe. Very accessible to beginners. Can be knitted either with a single DK yarn or with a fingering yarn and mohair to make it more cozy for winter. It is knitted from top to bottom. SIZES: (finished garment chest measurement): 80, 85, 90 (95, 100, 105, 110, 115) 120, 125, 130, 135, 140 145, 150, 155, 160, 165 cm RECOMMENDED EASE: between 3 and 10 cm positive ease according to your taste SAMPLE: 21 m x 31 rows = 10 cm in stockinette stitch in the round on 4mm/US 6 needles (or other size depending on your sample) WOOL: 1 thread of Double Merino (DK) - approximately 600, 670, 715 (760, 805, 850, 905, 960) 1005, 1070, 1130, 1180, 1240 1295, 1360, 1410, 1465, 1515 meters That is 6, 7, 7(7, 8, 8, 9, 9) 10, 10, 11, 11, 12 12, 13, 13, 14, 14 balls of Double Merino - Along with Anna OR 2 threads of Merino + Silk-Mohair: approximately the same quantity of each thread for a fingering and mohair mix. i.e. 3, 4, 4 (4, 4, 5, 5, 5) 5, 6, 6, 6,7 7, 7, 8, 8, 8 balls of Merino - Along with Anna and 3, 4, 4(4, 4, 5, 5, 5) 5, 6, 6, 6, 7 7, 7, 8, 8, 8 balls of Silk Mohair - Along with Anna Presentation versions: Merino Fingering & Silk Mohair - Along With Anna, Emerald / Tourmaline color - knitted in size 90 with 10 cm of positive ease. NEEDLES: Recommended needles (if your sample matches well): 4mm/US 6 for the body and sleeves 3.75mm/US 5 for the garter stitch finishes MATERIAL: Marker rings, pieces of wool to put the stitches on hold, wool needle to enter the threads
